title: Can you solve the rogue submarine riddle? Difficulty level: Master - Alex Rosenthal

multiple-choice.question: What was the initial problem faced by the protagonist in the rogue submarine?

options.label: A
options.text: Hacking into the nuclear missile launch override

options.label: B
options.text: Smuggling themselves aboard the submarine

options.label: C
options.text: Finding the override code

options.label: D
options.text: Activating the countdown

multiple-choice.question: What was the boss's strategy for ensuring that no single minion could launch nuclear missiles on their own?

options.label: A
options.text: He gave each minion a set of distinct positive integers with at least two elements, each less than 7

options.label: B
options.text: He forbade the minions from sharing the numbers with each other

options.label: C
options.text: He gave each minion a unique code that could only be used once

options.label: D
options.text: He gave each minion a code that was related to the other minion's code

multiple-choice.question: What was the crucial insight that A had when he said "I don't know whether you know my number"?

options.label: A
options.text: That B could conceivably have something with the potential to reveal A's number

options.label: B
options.text: That B had already figured out A's number

options.label: C
options.text: That A had already figured out B's number

options.label: D
options.text: That the boss's numbers must be less than 7

multiple-choice.question: What was the pattern that A noticed when factoring B's number?

options.label: A
options.text: It could be prime, where the product must be of 1 and itself

options.label: B
options.text: It could be the product of 1 and the square of a prime, such as 4

options.label: C
options.text: It could be the product of 2 and the square of a prime, such as 8

options.label: D
options.text: It could be the product of 3 and the square of a prime, such as 9

multiple-choice.question: What was the conclusion that A drew from his first statement?

options.label: A
options.text: That B could have something with the potential to reveal A's number

options.label: B
options.text: That A's number must be a sum of their factors

options.label: C
options.text: That A's number must be a product of their factors

options.label: D
options.text: That A's number must be a combination of their factors

multiple-choice.question: What was the reason why A eliminated 3 and 4 as possibilities for his number?

options.label: A
options.text: Because if the sum was either, the product could only be 2 or 3

options.label: B
options.text: Because if the sum was either, the product could only be 4 or 5

options.label: C
options.text: Because if the sum was either, the product could only be 6 or 7

options.label: D
options.text: Because if the sum was either, the product could only be 8 or 9

multiple-choice.question: What was the crucial thing to remember when considering B's number?

options.label: A
options.text: That there's no guarantee that B's number is on A's list

options.label: B
options.text: That there's a guarantee that B's number is on A's list

options.label: C
options.text: That B's number must be a product of their factors

options.label: D
options.text: That B's number must be a sum of their factors

multiple-choice.question: What was the result of considering the product 5 and breaking it down into its factors?

options.label: A
options.text: It could be broken down into 1+4

options.label: B
options.text: It could be broken down into 2+3

options.label: C
options.text: It could be broken down into 1+2+4

options.label: D
options.text: It could be broken down into 1+2+3

multiple-choice.question: What was the result of considering the product 6 and breaking it down into its factors?

options.label: A
options.text: It could be broken down into 1+5

options.label: B
options.text: It could be broken down into 2+4

options.label: C
options.text: It could be broken down into 1+2+3

options.label: D
options.text: It could be broken down into 1+2+4

multiple-choice.question: What was the final conclusion drawn by A about the override code?

options.label: A
options.text: That the override code was 5 and 4

options.label: B
options.text: That the override code was 6 and 5

options.label: C
options.text: That the override code was 7 and 8

options.label: D
options.text: That the override code was 9 and 10

title: You could have a secret twin (but not the way you think) - Kayla Mandel Sheets

multiple-choice.question: What is the term for an individual who has two genomes present in the tissues of their body?

options.label: A
options.text: Mosaicism

options.label: B
options.text: Chimerism

options.label: C
options.text: Genetic mutation

options.label: D
options.text: Twin syndrome

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the Boston woman who discovered that two of her adult sons were not biologically hers?

options.label: A
options.text: Karen Keegan

options.label: B
options.text: Jane Doe

options.label: C
options.text: Sarah Johnson

options.label: D
options.text: Emily Williams

multiple-choice.question: What is the most common form of chimerism, where a mother and fetus swap cells in the flow of nutrients across the placenta?

options.label: A
options.text: In utero chimerism

options.label: B
options.text: Tissue transplant chimerism

options.label: C
options.text: Fetal stem cell chimerism

options.label: D
options.text: Maternal-fetal chimerism

multiple-choice.question: What is the term for undifferentiated cells that are able to develop into any specialized cell?

options.label: A
options.text: Stem cells

options.label: B
options.text: Fetal cells

options.label: C
options.text: Tissue cells

options.label: D
options.text: Organ cells

multiple-choice.question: Why does the mother's immune system initially not detect the fetal cells?

options.label: A
options.text: Because the fetal cells are too small

options.label: B
options.text: Because the fetal cells are too old

options.label: C
options.text: Because the mother's immune system is suppressed during pregnancy

options.label: D
options.text: Because the fetal cells are too young

multiple-choice.question: What happened to Karen Keegan's twin sister?

options.label: A
options.text: She was born and died shortly after birth

options.label: B
options.text: She was born and lived a normal life

options.label: C
options.text: She was never born

options.label: D
options.text: She was born but died many years later

multiple-choice.question: What is the condition where an individual has two-toned skin or hair, or two different colored eyes, but most are believed to have no visible signs of the condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Chimerism

options.label: B
options.text: Mosaicism

options.label: C
options.text: Genetic mutation

options.label: D
options.text: Twin syndrome

multiple-choice.question: What is the term for the amalgam of three different animals in Greek mythology?

options.label: A
options.text: Chimera

options.label: B
options.text: Mosaic

options.label: C
options.text: Genetic code

options.label: D
options.text: Twin pregnancy

multiple-choice.question: What is the percentage of a father's sperm that can carry a second genome from an embryonic twin?
What is the estimated percentage of individual births that started out as twin pregnancies?

options.label: A
options.text: 1 in 8

options.label: B
options.text: 1 in 10

options.label: C
options.text: 1 in 12

options.label: D
options.text: 1 in 16

title: Earth's mysterious red glow, explained - Zoe Pierrat

multiple-choice.question: What was the initial purpose of the satellite that circled Earth in 2009?

options.label: A
options.text: To study the effects of climate change

options.label: B
options.text: To research the spectral signature of carbon dioxide

options.label: C
options.text: To track the movement of tectonic plates

options.label: D
options.text: To monitor the Earth's magnetic field

multiple-choice.question: What was the unexpected wavelength of unknown origin that researchers noticed while studying the Earth's surface?

options.label: A
options.text: A wavelength of ultraviolet light

options.label: B
options.text: A wavelength of infrared light

options.label: C
options.text: A wavelength of red light

options.label: D
options.text: A wavelength of X-ray light

multiple-choice.question: What was the source of the unexpected wavelength of red light?

options.label: A
options.text: Reflected sunlight

options.label: B
options.text: Human-made emissions

options.label: C
options.text: Places with lots of plants

options.label: D
options.text: Volcanic eruptions

multiple-choice.question: What is the process by which plants use light to grow?

options.label: A
options.text: Respiration

options.label: B
options.text: Photosynthesis

options.label: C
options.text: Decomposition

options.label: D
options.text: Fermentation

multiple-choice.question: What is the byproduct of photosynthesis that is essential for life on Earth?

options.label: A
options.text: Oxygen

options.label: B
options.text: Carbon dioxide

options.label: C
options.text: Glucose

options.label: D
options.text: Water

multiple-choice.question: What happens to excess light absorbed by plants during photosynthesis?

options.label: A
options.text: It is stored as chemical energy

options.label: B
options.text: It is converted into heat and dissipated out of the leaves

options.label: C
options.text: It is radiated back out at a different wavelength

options.label: D
options.text: It is reflected back into the atmosphere

multiple-choice.question: What is the process by which plants radiate light back out at a different wavelength?

options.label: A
options.text: Respiration

options.label: B
options.text: Photosynthesis

options.label: C
options.text: Chlorophyll fluorescence

options.label: D
options.text: Decomposition

multiple-choice.question: What is the significance of chlorophyll fluorescence in monitoring plant health?

options.label: A
options.text: It is a direct measure of photosynthetic activity

options.label: B
options.text: It is a measure of the amount of oxygen released by plants

options.label: C
options.text: It is a measure of the amount of carbon absorbed by plants

options.label: D
options.text: It is a measure of the amount of water used by plants

multiple-choice.question: What is one of the benefits of using chlorophyll fluorescence to monitor plant health?

options.label: A
options.text: It can detect stress in plants before visible signs appear

options.label: B
options.text: It can detect stress in plants after visible signs appear

options.label: C
options.text: It can detect stress in plants only in certain environments

options.label: D
options.text: It can detect stress in plants only in certain types of plants

multiple-choice.question: What is one of the applications of using chlorophyll fluorescence to monitor plant health?

options.label: A
options.text: Monitoring harmful phytoplankton blooms

options.label: B
options.text: Tracking the effects of drought in the Amazon and Great Plains

options.label: C
options.text: Monitoring the health of forests

options.label: D
options.text: Monitoring the health of crops
